img_source: Par Henry Vandyke Carter, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪轉向動作（如Cutback、Snap）的核心動力來源。負責將上半身的旋轉力矩傳遞至衝浪板，使板緣切入水面，協調上下半身以完成流暢的S型軌跡。
desc_en: The powerhouse for rotational maneuvers (e.g., Cutback, Snap). Transfers upper body torque to the surfboard to engage the rails, coordinating upper and lower body for fluid S-turns.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 與腹外斜肌協同工作，控制上半身在不穩定板面上的精細旋轉。在管浪（Barrel）或快速轉向中，負責維持軀幹的穩定張力與平衡。
desc_en: Works with external obliques to control fine rotation on the unstable board. Maintains trunk stability and tension for balance inside the barrel or during rapid directional changes.

img_source: Mongrangvebet, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 「起乘（Pop-up）」動作的關鍵爆發肌。負責在撐起瞬間將雙腿快速收至胸前。在長時間划水時穩定軀幹，防止背部過度反折導致痠痛。
desc_en: Key explosive muscle for the 'Pop-up'. Flexes the trunk to snap the legs under the chest quickly. Stabilizes the torso during paddling to prevent excessive hyperextension and back pain.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在不穩定的海面上提供深層核心穩定。在被浪捲入（Wipeout）閉氣時，協助控制橫隔膜與腹內壓，保護脊椎免受亂流衝擊。
desc_en: Provides deep core stability on unstable waters. Assists in diaphragm control and intra-abdominal pressure during breath-holds after a wipeout, protecting the spine from turbulence.

img_source: Bildbearbetning: sv:Användare:Chrizz, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責划水（Paddling）後半段的拉水動作。在起乘瞬間協助穩定上半身，以及在鑽浪（Duck Dive）時用力控制板頭下潛的深度。
desc_en: Active during the pull phase of paddling. Stabilizes the upper body during the pop-up and forcefully controls board depth during a duck dive.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時持續協助屈肘動作，是划水耐力的關鍵。長時間衝浪後，手臂前側深處的痠痛感常源於此肌肉的過度使用。
desc_en: Consistently assists elbow flexion during paddling, key for endurance. Deep aching in the front of the arm after long sessions often stems from overuse here.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助划水時的手臂前伸與內收。確保划水軌跡維持在身體兩側（沿著板緣），增加划水效率並減少肩膀負擔。
desc_en: Assists in arm flexion and adduction during paddling. Ensures the stroke stays close to the body (along the rails) for maximum efficiency and reduced shoulder strain.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 「起乘（Pop-up）」與「鑽浪（Duck Dive）」的爆發力來源。負責快速伸直手肘將身體撐起站立，或將衝浪板用力推入水中以穿越浪壁。
desc_en: Explosive power source for the 'Pop-up' and 'Duck Dive'. Rapidly extends the elbow to lift the body for standing or push the board deep underwater to pass through waves.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水動作的回復期（Recovery）負責將手臂向後上方提起。在起乘推板時提供肩膀伸展的穩定度，是流暢划水節奏的關鍵。
desc_en: Lifts the arm backward and upward during the paddling recovery phase. Provides shoulder extension stability during the pop-up push; key for a fluid paddling rhythm.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在起乘撐起身體的過程中，負責最後階段的手肘鎖定與穩定。在鑽浪時維持持續的推力，確保潛得足夠深。
desc_en: Responsible for final elbow locking and stabilization during the pop-up. Maintains continuous pushing force during duck dives to ensure sufficient depth.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪者的「划水支柱」。長時間維持背部反弓（Arching）姿勢以觀察海浪，極易疲勞。強壯的豎脊肌能預防常見的衝浪者下背痛。
desc_en: The surfer's 'paddling pillar'. Maintains the arched back posture for hours to scan waves. Strength here prevents common surfer's lower back pain caused by prolonged extension.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪划水的主引擎。負責強力的手臂下壓與後拉動作，決定追浪的速度。在轉向時，透過上半身帶動背肌來傳遞力量至板緣。
desc_en: The main engine for paddling. Responsible for the powerful pull and push-down phase, dictating wave-catching speed. Transfers force to the rails during turns via upper body rotation.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責在浪壁上斜跑（Trim）時的側面穩定。協助提骨盆動作，讓衝浪板能靈活地進行Rail-to-Rail的轉換，是維持平衡的關鍵。
desc_en: Provides lateral stability when trimming on the wave face. Assists in hip hiking to facilitate agile rail-to-rail transitions; critical for balance.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS), CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在衝浪板上快速轉換重心時，防止腳踝過度內翻扭傷。對於控制板緣（Edging）的微調至關重要，特別是在波浪顛簸時。
desc_en: Prevents ankle inversion sprains during rapid weight shifts on the board. Crucial for fine-tuning edge control (rail work), especially in choppy conditions.

name_zh: 腓骨長肌（重複項-請參照Peroneus Longus）
img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責將大腳趾球壓向板面，這是在正手浪（Frontside）底部轉向（Bottom Turn）時產生驅動力的關鍵機制，協助鎖定板緣。
desc_en: Presses the ball of the big toe into the deck; a key mechanism for generating drive during a frontside bottom turn, helping to lock the rail.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪加速（Pumping）與空中動作著地（Landing）的緩衝關鍵。提供爆發性的蹠屈力量來控制板尾，吸收落水時的巨大衝擊。
desc_en: Key for pumping for speed and cushioning landings from aerials. Provides explosive plantarflexion to control the tail and absorb high impacts upon landing.

img_source: Polygon data is generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS), CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 站浪時的耐力肌。在不穩定的海面上持續微調小腿角度以維持直立平衡（特別是微蹲姿勢），對於長浪的續航力很重要。
desc_en: The endurance muscle for riding. Continuously adjusts calf angle to maintain upright balance (especially in a crouch) on unstable water; vital for long rides.

img_source: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/df/Inferior_view_of_tibialis_posterior_muscle_-_animation.gif
desc: 足弓的避震器。在波濤洶湧（Choppy）的海面上吸收震動，防止足弓塌陷並維持抓板力，預防足底筋膜炎。
desc_en: The arch's shock absorber. Absorbs vibrations in choppy conditions, preventing arch collapse and maintaining board grip, helping prevent plantar fasciitis.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 擴大腳掌外側的支撐面積。在進行急轉彎或切回動作（Cutback）時，提供重要的側向抓地力與穩定性。
desc_en: Expands the lateral base of support. Provides crucial lateral grip and stability during sharp turns or cutbacks.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制大拇指抓緊板面。在趴板轉站立（Pop-up）的瞬間，協助足部快速定位並穩定足弓，防止側翻。
desc_en: Controls the big toe's grip on the deck. Assists in rapid foot placement and arch stabilization during the pop-up, preventing roll-over.

img_source: Image:Gray445.png modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助大拇指扣住衝浪板上的防滑蠟或止滑墊，特別是在浪況劇烈晃動或著陸時提供額外的抓地力。
desc_en: Helps the big toe grip the wax or traction pad, providing extra hold especially when the wave is turbulent or upon landing.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS), CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在起乘收腿時協助腳背勾起（背屈），避免腳趾撞到板緣或插入水中（Catching a rail）導致起乘失敗。
desc_en: Dorsiflexes the foot during the pop-up leg tuck, preventing toes from hitting the rail or dragging in the water (catching a rail) which causes pop-up failure.

img_source: Was a bee, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 起乘時確保大拇指翹起，避免「吃水」。在後腳控制板尾時協助調整細微角度，保持操控靈活性。
desc_en: Ensures the big toe clears the deck during pop-up. Assists in fine-tuning angles when the back foot is controlling the tail, maintaining maneuverability.

name_zh: 拇趾外展肌（內在肌視角）
img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 足部核心（Foot Core）。直接感受板面回饋，對於赤足衝浪時的本體感覺與重心微調至關重要。
desc_en: Foot core. Directly senses board feedback; crucial for proprioception and weight micro-adjustments when surfing barefoot.

img_source: Berichard, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 像吸盤一樣抓緊衝浪板。增加腳掌與蠟面的摩擦力，防止在高G力轉彎或落地時滑落。
desc_en: Grips the surfboard like a suction cup. Increases friction between foot and wax, preventing slips during high-G turns or landings.

img_source: Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持腳趾在衝浪板上的動態平衡。防止腳趾過度蜷曲（Clawing），保持最大的接觸面積以利操控板面。
desc_en: Maintains dynamic toe balance on the board. Prevents excessive clawing, keeping maximum contact area for board control.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪轉向的「踏板肌」。透過壓低第一蹠骨來啟動正手底部轉向（Bottom Turn），將全身力量有效傳導至板緣。
desc_en: The 'pedal muscle' for turning. Initiates frontside bottom turns by depressing the first metatarsal, effectively transferring full-body power to the rail.

img_source: Berichard d'après Gray's anatomy, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 輔助腳趾抓板。在浪面顛簸時修正腳趾的抓地力方向，確保穩定的站姿與板面控制。
desc_en: Assists toe gripping. Corrects the line of pull for grip stability on bumpy wave faces, ensuring a solid stance and board control.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 鑽浪（Duck Dive）時緊抓板緣的關鍵。用力按壓板頭潛入水中時，大拇指的穩定度與張力依賴此肌肉。
desc_en: Crucial for gripping the rails during a Duck Dive. Thumb stability and tension depend on this muscle when forcefully pushing the nose underwater.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在頻繁的划水與鑽浪轉換中穩定前臂。維持手肘在最佳出力角度，防止長時間衝浪後的手臂僵硬。
desc_en: Stabilizes the forearm during frequent transitions between paddling and duck diving. Keeps the elbow at an optimal power angle, preventing stiffness after long sessions.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 起乘（Pop-up）撐板時的關鍵手腕穩定肌。防止手腕在承受全身重量的瞬間過度折疊受傷。
desc_en: Key wrist stabilizer during the pop-up push. Prevents wrist injury from excessive buckling under full body weight.

img_source: Me, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在起乘（Pop-up）時負責手腕的強力伸展與穩定，協助將上半身撐離板面。在鑽浪時也有助於推板頭下潛。
desc_en: Provides powerful wrist extension and stability during the pop-up, helping to push the upper body off the deck. Also aids in pushing the nose down during a duck dive.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划水（Paddling）入水階段維持手腕剛性，防止手掌受水阻翻折。在起乘推板時提供尺側支撐，確保力量垂直傳遞。
desc_en: Maintains wrist rigidity during the paddle entry phase, preventing the hand from buckling under water resistance. Provides ulnar support during the pop-up push, ensuring vertical force transmission.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時手掌應併攏微彎（槳狀），若此肌肉過度用力導致小指翹起，會增加指縫漏水，降低划水效率。
desc_en: Hands should be cupped like paddles during paddling. Overactivation of this muscle causes the little finger to splay, creating gaps that let water slip through and reducing stroke efficiency.

img_source: Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水回臂（Recovery）出水面時，負責手指伸展以減少帶水。但在入水後應放鬆，避免手指過度僵硬伸直。
desc_en: Extends fingers as the hand exits the water during the paddle recovery to minimize drag. However, should relax upon entry to avoid rigid, inefficient finger posture.

img_source: Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制食指動作。在衝浪中應保持手指併攏，若食指單獨翹起會破壞「槳手」的完整性，影響划水推進力。
desc_en: Controls the index finger. Fingers should remain closed while surfing; pointing the index finger breaks the 'paddle' shape of the hand, compromising propulsion.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助張開大拇指，在鑽浪（Duck Dive）抓握板緣時提供張力。在划水時則應放鬆貼合食指側緣。
desc_en: Assists in thumb abduction, providing tension when gripping the rails for a Duck Dive. During paddling, it should relax to let the thumb rest against the index finger.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責大拇指的完全伸展。在鑽浪下潛時，幫助大拇指扣住板緣。划水時若過度翹起大拇指會增加前臂疲勞。
desc_en: Fully extends the thumb. Helps the thumb hook onto the rails during a duck dive. Hitchhiking the thumb during paddling increases forearm fatigue needlessly.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水（Paddling）抱水期的關鍵肌。負責手腕屈曲，幫助手掌「抓水（Catch）」，將水流向後推，產生前進動力。
desc_en: Key muscle for the catch phase of paddling. Flexes the wrist to cup and 'catch' the water, pushing it backward to generate propulsion.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助划水時的手腕屈曲與固定。在鑽浪（Duck Dive）用力推板尾入水時，負責穩定手腕尺側。
desc_en: Assists wrist flexion and fixation during paddling. Stabilizes the ulnar side of the wrist when forcefully pushing the tail down during a duck dive.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持划水時手指併攏微彎的「杯狀手（Cupped hand）」。不需過度用力握拳，只需保持手型以最大化推水面積。
desc_en: Maintains the 'cupped hand' shape (fingers adducted and slightly flexed) for paddling. No need to clench; just hold the shape to maximize water displacement.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 與深指屈肌共同控制划水手型。在鑽浪時，協助手指緊扣衝浪板邊緣（Rails），防止板子脫手。
desc_en: Works with the deep flexor to control paddling hand shape. Assists fingers in gripping the surfboard rails tightly during a duck dive to prevent losing the board.

img_source: Me, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 鑽浪（Duck Dive）的關鍵肌。負責大拇指強力扣住板緣，與其餘手指形成對握力，對抗浮力與海浪衝擊。
desc_en: Crucial for Duck Dives. Powers the thumb to grip the rail firmly, creating opposing force against the fingers to fight buoyancy and wave impact.

img_source: Henry Gray, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助屈腕並拉緊手掌筋膜。在划水抱水階段（Catch）有助於穩定手掌結構，承受水阻。
desc_en: Assists wrist flexion and tightens palmar fascia. Helps stabilize the palm structure against water resistance during the catch phase of paddling.

img_source: Selket at English Wikipedia, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划水（Paddling）入水時維持前臂的旋前姿勢（拇指朝下入水），減少入水阻力並引導正確的划水軌跡。
desc_en: Maintains forearm pronation (thumb entering first) during paddle entry, reducing drag and guiding the correct stroke trajectory.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時負責前臂旋前與輔助屈肘。在起乘推板瞬間，協助穩定手肘位置，防止手臂外開。
desc_en: Responsible for pronation and assisting elbow flexion during paddling. Helps stabilize elbow position during the pop-up push, preventing arm flaring.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水回復期（Recovery）時轉動前臂，讓大拇指朝上或外側出水。靈活的旋後肌有助於流暢的空中移臂動作。
desc_en: Rotates the forearm during the paddle recovery phase, orienting the thumb up or out. A flexible supinator aids in a fluid aerial arm recovery.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時應保持放鬆併攏。若此肌肉緊繃導致小指外張，會造成「漏水」並降低划水推力。
desc_en: Should remain relaxed and adducted during paddling. Tension causing the little finger to splay leads to water 'leakage' and reduced propulsion.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 鑽浪（Duck Dive）時協助張開虎口，緊握板緣。強壯的拇指肌群是控制板頭下潛深度的關鍵。
desc_en: Assists in opening the thumb web space to grip the rails during a Duck Dive. Strong thumb muscles are key to controlling nose depth.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時負責將大拇指貼近食指，維持流線型手勢。防止大拇指外開增加不必要的阻力。
desc_en: Keeps the thumb close to the index finger during paddling, maintaining a streamlined hand shape. Prevents thumb drag from unnecessary abduction.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時應放鬆，避免手指像五爪金龍般張開。但在鑽浪抓板時，負責提供手指間的穩定張力。
desc_en: Should relax during paddling to avoid splayed fingers. However, provides inter-finger stability tension when gripping the board for a duck dive.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助中指動作。衝浪划水強調「像鏟子一樣」的手型，此肌肉不應過度收縮導致手指分岔。
desc_en: Assists middle finger action. Surfing paddling requires a 'spade-like' hand; this muscle shouldn't over-contract to cause finger splaying.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 無名指外展肌。長距離划水後，手部小肌肉容易疲勞，應注意保持手指輕鬆併攏而非僵硬張開。
desc_en: Ring finger abductor. Small hand muscles fatigue after long paddles; focus on keeping fingers loosely adducted rather than rigidly splayed.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 小指外展肌。划水效率殺手之一，若小指持續分岔，水流會從指縫溜走，浪費寶貴的體力。
desc_en: Little finger abductor. An efficiency killer in paddling; if the little finger splays, water slips through the gap, wasting precious energy.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助維持划水時的「杯狀手」。在鑽浪時協助小指側緊扣板緣，防止手滑。
desc_en: Helps maintain the 'cupped hand' during paddling. Assists the ulnar side grip on the rails during a duck dive to prevent slipping.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 鑽浪抓板的主力之一。負責屈曲拇指，將板子深深壓入水中。划水時則應放鬆。
desc_en: A key muscle for rail gripping in duck dives. Flexes the thumb to push the board deep. Should be relaxed during paddling.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 微調划水手型。負責掌指關節屈曲，形成完美的推水面，同時避免手指過度捲曲造成亂流。
desc_en: Fine-tunes paddling hand shape. Flexes MCP joints to create a perfect pushing surface while preventing excessive curling that causes turbulence.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持中指在划水時的穩定位置。確保手指間沒有空隙，最大化划水推進力。
desc_en: Maintains middle finger stability during paddling. Ensures no gaps between fingers to maximize propulsion.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持無名指與中指併攏。長浪衝浪者需注意手指放鬆，避免這些小肌肉抽筋。
desc_en: Keeps the ring finger adducted to the middle finger. Surfers on long sessions must ensure hand relaxation to prevent cramping in these small muscles.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 確保小指貼合無名指，封閉划水時的手掌邊緣，防止水流散失。
desc_en: Ensures the little finger sits tight against the ring finger, sealing the palm edge during paddling to prevent water slip.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 增強手掌的杯狀結構（Cupping），這是高效划水的基本手型。在鑽浪時協助抓握板緣。
desc_en: Enhances the cupping of the palm, fundamental for efficient paddling. Assists in gripping the rails during duck dives.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 鑽浪（Duck Dive）和烏龜翻（Turtle Roll）時至關重要。負責大拇指對掌緊抓板緣，確保浪頭打來時板子不會飛走。
desc_en: Critical for Duck Dives and Turtle Rolls. Opposes the thumb to grip the rails tightly, ensuring the board isn't knocked away by the whitewater.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責食指內收。衝浪划水時，必須保持手指併攏以形成完整的「槳」，防止水流從指縫流失，確保最大推進效率。
desc_en: Adducts the index finger. During paddling, fingers must remain closed to form a solid 'paddle', preventing water from slipping through gaps to ensure maximum propulsion efficiency.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責無名指內收。與其他手部肌肉協同，維持划水時手掌的封閉性。疲勞時手指容易不自覺張開，需有意識地維持併攏。
desc_en: Adducts the ring finger. Works with other hand muscles to maintain a closed palm during paddling. Fingers tend to splay when fatigued; conscious effort is needed to keep them adducted.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責小指內收。衝浪划水效率的關鍵指標之一，確保手掌外緣封閉，讓每一划都能抓到最多的水。
desc_en: Adducts the little finger. A key indicator of paddling efficiency; ensures the outer edge of the palm is sealed so that every stroke catches the maximum amount of water.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 位於小魚際皮下。在鑽浪（Duck Dive）用力抓握板緣時，協助手掌皮膚產生摩擦力與緩衝。
desc_en: Located under the hypothenar skin. Assists in creating friction and cushioning for the palm skin when gripping the rails tightly during a duck dive.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 恐懼與壓力的指示器。面對大浪或被浪捲入（Wipeout）時，衝浪者常不自覺緊咬牙關。放鬆咬肌有助於在水下保持冷靜與節省氧氣。
desc_en: Fear and stress indicator. Surfers often unconsciously clench their jaw when facing big waves or during a wipeout. Relaxing the masseter helps maintain calm and conserve oxygen underwater.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在劇烈划水或衝浪時，若用力咬合會導致頸部肌肉連帶緊繃，影響轉頭觀察浪況的靈活度。應保持下顎微張放鬆。
desc_en: Forceful clenching during intense paddling or riding tightens neck muscles, restricting head mobility for scanning waves. Keep the jaw slightly open and relaxed.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 長時間暴露在陽光下瞇眼與咬牙會造成顳肌緊張引起頭痛。在等浪（Waiting）時應意識放鬆臉部，減少不必要的能量消耗。
desc_en: Squinting in bright sun and jaw clenching causes tension headaches. Consciously relax facial muscles while waiting for waves to conserve energy.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在坐板等浪（Straddling）時負責夾緊衝浪板，保持平衡。在管浪（Barrel Riding）中，協助雙膝向內靠攏以縮小身體體積。
desc_en: Grips the board with legs while sitting (straddling) to maintain balance. In barrel riding, helps adduct knees to compact the body profile.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪轉向的爆發引擎。在底部轉向（Bottom Turn）時負責強力伸髖，對抗強大的離心力。空中動作落地時，負責離心收縮吸收衝擊。
desc_en: Explosive engine for turns. Powers hip extension during bottom turns against high G-forces. Eccentrically absorbs impact during aerial landings.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在不穩定的板面上維持單腳或前後腳站立的骨盆水平。防止膝蓋內扣（Knee Valgus），特別是在急轉彎或落地緩衝時，保護膝關節。
desc_en: Maintains pelvic level on the unstable board. Prevents knee valgus, especially during sharp turns or landing compression, protecting the knee joint.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 深層髖關節穩定肌。在複雜的浪壁地形（Chop）上衝浪時，將股骨頭鎖定在髖臼內，提供精細的平衡控制。
desc_en: Deep hip stabilizer. Locks the femoral head in the socket when surfing on choppy wave faces, providing fine balance control.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助膝蓋內扣動作（Knee Tuck），這在管浪衝浪（Barrel Riding）或為了降低重心以保持穩定時非常重要。
desc_en: Assists in the knee tuck motion, which is vital for barrel riding or lowering the center of gravity for stability.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 起乘（Pop-up）的核心啟動肌。負責在趴姿撐起瞬間，將雙腿快速拉向胸口，完成站立動作。
desc_en: Core initiator of the Pop-up. Pulls the legs rapidly toward the chest the moment the upper body pushes up, enabling the transition to standing.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 連接軀幹與下肢的關鍵。在起乘（Pop-up）時極速收縮將膝蓋帶至胸前。在衝浪過程中，控制骨盆前傾角度，影響重心轉移的流暢度。
desc_en: Vital link between trunk and legs. Contracts rapidly during the pop-up to bring knees to chest. Controls pelvic tilt while riding, affecting fluid weight transfer.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在衝浪板上進行大幅度扭轉與平衡調整時，負責穩定髖關節深處，防止股骨頭移位。
desc_en: Stabilizes the deep hip joint during extreme twisting and balance adjustments on the surfboard, preventing femoral head displacement.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 微調後腳在板尾的控制力。在需要精細控制轉向角度（Pivot）時，與其他外旋肌共同作用，傳遞下肢扭力至衝浪板。
desc_en: Fine-tunes back foot control on the tail. Works with other rotators to transmit lower body torque to the board for precise pivoting.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在坐板（Sitting）時協助雙腿夾緊衝浪板。起乘時協助髖部屈曲，快速將腿部拉至定位。
desc_en: Helps grip the board with legs while sitting. Assists hip flexion during the pop-up, rapidly pulling the leg into position.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制後腳的外旋動作，這是衝浪轉向（Carving）的基礎。過度使用或長時間坐在板上可能導致梨狀肌症候群。
desc_en: Controls external rotation of the back leg, fundamental for carving. Overuse or prolonged sitting on the board can lead to Piriformis Syndrome.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 起乘（Pop-up）的關鍵肌。負責將下半身爆發性地拉向胸口。在衝浪過程中穩定腰椎，吸收來自波浪的垂直衝擊。
desc_en: Key muscle for the Pop-up. Explosively pulls the lower body toward the chest. Stabilizes the lumbar spine while riding, absorbing vertical shock from the waves.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在後腳踩在止滑墊（Tail pad）上轉向時，提供強力的外旋穩定，確保動作精準不打滑。
desc_en: Provides powerful external rotation stability when the back foot is on the tail pad turning, ensuring precision and preventing slippage.

img_source: colorized by Michael Gasperl, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助起乘時的提腿動作，並透過髂脛束穩定膝蓋外側，特別是在波浪顛簸需要持續屈膝緩衝時。
desc_en: Assists leg lifting during the pop-up. Stabilizes the lateral knee via the IT Band, especially during sustained crouched riding in choppy water.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 膝關節解鎖肌。在準備深蹲（Crouch）或吸收落地衝擊時，啟動膝蓋屈曲。防止膝蓋過度伸直鎖死。
desc_en: Knee unlocker. Initiates knee flexion when preparing to crouch or absorb landing impact. Prevents dangerous knee hyperextension.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在長時間划水維持抬頭姿勢時極易緊繃。過度使用會壓迫神經導致手臂發麻（衝浪者常見問題）。
desc_en: Prone to tightness from holding the head up while paddling for hours. Overuse compresses nerves, leading to arm numbness (a common surfer ailment).

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助張口與吞嚥。在被浪壓入水中（Hold down）緊急換氣時，協助呼吸道快速打開。
desc_en: Assists mouth opening and swallowing. Helps rapidly open the airway for gasping air after being held down by a wave.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 對抗長時間趴板划水造成的頸椎後仰壓力（Cervical Extension）。強化此肌肉可預防衝浪者頸部疼痛。
desc_en: Counteracts the stress of prolonged cervical extension while paddling. Strengthening this muscle prevents 'surfer's neck' pain.

img_source: User:Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划水抬頭時，協助穩定下顎與舌骨區域。應保持放鬆以免造成頸前側緊繃。
desc_en: Stabilizes the jaw and hyoid region while paddling with head up. Keep relaxed to avoid anterior neck tension.

img_source: Berichard, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 連結肩胛骨與頸部。在衝浪划水時，協調肩胛骨的運動與頸部的穩定，防止因肩膀過度抬高而拉傷頸部。
desc_en: Connects scapula to neck. Coordinates scapular movement and neck stability during paddling, preventing neck strain from excessive shoulder elevation.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪划水時維持頭部抬起的關鍵肌。同時負責快速轉頭觀察後方浪況。長時間衝浪後此肌肉常極度疲勞。
desc_en: Key muscle for holding the head up while paddling. Also enables rapid head turning to check for waves behind. Often extremely fatigued after long sessions.

img_source: User:Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在激烈划水或鑽浪後的急促呼吸中，穩定喉部。協助維持頸部前側的張力平衡。
desc_en: Stabilizes the larynx during heavy breathing after intense paddling or duck diving. Helps maintain anterior neck tension balance.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 核心底板。在應對不可預測的海浪衝擊或高處落地（Drop）時，反射性收縮以穩定骨盆內臟與腹內壓。
desc_en: Core floor. Reflexively contracts to stabilize pelvic organs and intra-abdominal pressure when bracing for unpredictable wave impact or landing a drop.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 鑽浪（Duck Dive）時負責將單腳用力抬高（伸髖），或用膝蓋壓板尾。在轉向時提供膝關節外旋穩定。
desc_en: Lifts the leg high (hip extension) or presses the knee on the tail during a Duck Dive. Provides lateral knee stability during turns.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在起乘（Pop-up）時快速屈膝，將雙腿收至胸前。在深蹲騎乘（Crouch）時，協助微調膝蓋角度以適應浪面變化。
desc_en: Flexes the knee rapidly during the pop-up to tuck legs under the chest. Assists in fine-tuning knee angles while crouching to adapt to wave face variations.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 起乘時負責勾腳尖（背屈），確保腳掌順利通過板面不絆倒。在衝浪時負責微調重心，將板緣拉向身體（如Cutback動作）。
desc_en: Dorsiflexes the foot during the pop-up to clear the deck without tripping. Fine-tunes balance while riding, pulling the rail toward the body (e.g., in a cutback).

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時負責手臂的前伸（Reach），決定划幅長度。在起乘與鑽浪時，負責強力的推板動作（Push）。
desc_en: Responsible for the forward reach during paddling, determining stroke length. Powers the push-up phase during the pop-up and duck dive.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水回復期（Recovery）負責將手臂提起離開水面。在衝浪站立時，負責抬起雙臂維持平衡（如走板或通過白花區）。
desc_en: Lifts the arm out of the water during the paddle recovery phase. Holds arms up for balance while riding (e.g., nose riding or whitewash foam).

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時的輔助動力。在轉向（Turn）時，負責帶動後手向後打開胸廓，引導板頭轉向。
desc_en: Accessory power for paddling. During turns, opens the chest by pulling the trailing arm back, guiding the board's rotation.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 肩袖穩定的關鍵。在划水提臂（Recovery）時負責外旋手臂。衝浪者常見的「旋轉肌袖損傷」常發生於此。
desc_en: Key for rotator cuff stability. Externally rotates the arm during paddle recovery. A common site for 'rotator cuff injuries' in surfers.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 長時間抬頭划水會導致此肌肉慢性緊繃與頸部僵硬。應適時放鬆肩膀，避免聳肩划水。
desc_en: Prolonged head-up paddling causes chronic tightness and neck stiffness here. Relax shoulders periodically to avoid shrugging while paddling.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水抱水期（Catch）負責內旋手臂以抓水。強力的內旋有助於提升划水效率，並保護肩關節前側穩定。
desc_en: Internally rotates the arm during the catch phase of paddling. Strong internal rotation improves stroke efficiency and stabilizes the anterior shoulder.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水提臂（Recovery）的啟動肌。負責手臂外展的前15度。反覆的划水動作易導致棘上肌腱夾擠（游泳肩/衝浪肩）。
desc_en: Initiator of the paddle recovery. Responsible for the first 15 degrees of abduction. Repetitive paddling often leads to supraspinatus impingement (Swimmer's/Surfer's Shoulder).

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 「小背闊肌」。協助強力的划水動作（手臂內收與伸展）。在鑽浪時協助穩定手臂對抗浮力。
desc_en: The 'little lat'. Assists in powerful paddling strokes (arm adduction and extension). Helps stabilize arms against buoyancy during duck dives.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助划水回復期（Recovery）的手臂外旋。確保肱骨頭在頻繁划動中保持在關節窩中心。
desc_en: Assists arm external rotation during paddle recovery. Ensures the humeral head stays centered in the socket during repetitive stroking.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水時負責下壓肩胛骨，增加划水力臂並減少頸部壓力。起乘撐起身體時，穩定肩胛骨位置。
desc_en: Depresses the scapula during paddling, increasing stroke leverage and reducing neck stress. Stabilizes scapular position when pushing up for the pop-up.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責肩胛骨後收。衝浪划水時需保持挺胸（Chest up），此肌肉有助於維持正確的趴板姿勢，優化視野與重心。
desc_en: Retracts the scapula. Paddling requires a 'chest up' posture; this muscle helps maintain correct prone positioning for better vision and balance.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 長時間趴板抬頭（Neck Extension）會導致此肌肉過度緊繃。寒冷水溫下也容易因畏寒聳肩而痙攣。
desc_en: Prolonged neck extension while paddling causes excessive tension here. Also prone to cramping from shrugging in cold water.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助坐板（Straddling）時雙腿夾板。在衝浪轉向或管浪中，負責將膝蓋向內靠攏，穩定重心。
desc_en: Helps grip the board with legs while sitting. During turns or barrel riding, adducts the knees to stabilize the center of gravity.

img_source: Berichard, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 強力的髖伸展肌。在大幅度底部轉向（Bottom Turn）時提供後腳蹬伸的力量，同時控制大腿內收以鎖定板緣軌跡。
desc_en: Powerful hip extensor. Provides rear leg drive during deep bottom turns, while controlling thigh adduction to lock in the rail line.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助膝蓋屈曲與內收。在需要極度屈膝的管浪（Barrel）動作中，幫助雙腿併攏以適應狹小空間。
desc_en: Assists knee flexion and adduction. Helps keep legs together in deep crouches required for tight barrel riding.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 雙關節肌。起乘時負責屈髖（收腿），站立後負責伸膝（加速Pumping）。是連接起乘動作與站立騎乘的關鍵肌肉。
desc_en: Biarticular muscle. Flexes the hip (leg tuck) during pop-up, then extends the knee (pumping for speed) after standing. Vital bridge between pop-up and riding.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責髖部屈曲、外展與外旋。在長板衝浪的交叉步（Cross-stepping）或起乘時調整雙腳落點位置有重要作用。
desc_en: Flexes, abducts, and externally rotates the hip. Crucial for positioning legs during cross-stepping on a longboard or adjusting foot placement during the pop-up.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪加速（Pumping）的主要垂直動力源。負責膝蓋伸直，在浪壁上進行壓縮與釋放（Compression and Extension）以產生速度。
desc_en: Primary vertical power source for pumping. Extends the knee, enabling compression and extension cycles on the wave face to generate speed.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在強力轉向（Carving）時承受巨大的離心力負荷。同時也是吸收空中動作落地（Landing）衝擊的主要肌肉。
desc_en: Bears high G-force loads during powerful carving turns. Also the primary muscle for absorbing impact when landing aerial maneuvers.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 保護膝蓋的關鍵（VMO）。衝浪時膝蓋常處於半蹲扭轉狀態，此肌肉負責穩定髕骨軌跡，防止膝蓋受傷。
desc_en: Key protector of the knee (VMO). Surfing involves constant twisted squatting; this muscle stabilizes patellar tracking to prevent knee injury.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 閉氣生存肌。在被大浪捲入（Wipeout）時，負責控制呼吸與維持腹內壓，保護核心並幫助冷靜應對缺氧狀況。
desc_en: Breath-hold survival muscle. During a wipeout, controls breathing and maintains intra-abdominal pressure, protecting the core and aiding calm under hypoxia.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責強制呼氣。在衝出水面或鑽浪後，協助快速排空肺部氣體以便進行下一次深呼吸。
desc_en: Responsible for forced expiration. Helps rapidly expel air from lungs after surfacing or duck diving to prepare for the next deep breath.

img_source: DrJanaOfficial, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 起乘（Pop-up）與鑽浪（Duck Dive）的爆發肌。負責用力的伏地挺身動作，將身體撐起或將板子推入水中。划水時也協助內收與內旋。
desc_en: Explosive muscle for Pop-ups and Duck Dives. Powers the forceful push-up to stand or submerge the board. Also assists adduction/internal rotation during paddling.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 衝浪者常見的緊繃部位。過度划水會導致圓肩（Rounded Shoulders），限制肩關節活動度並影響呼吸深度。
desc_en: Common tight spot for surfers. Excessive paddling leads to rounded shoulders, restricting shoulder mobility and impairing breathing depth.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 划水前伸（Reach）時將肩胛骨往前帶。在起乘（Pop-up）的最後推離階段，穩定肩胛骨防止翼狀突起。
desc_en: Protracts the scapula during the paddling reach. Stabilizes the scapula (prevents winging) during the final push-off phase of the pop-up.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在激烈划水或鑽浪推板時，穩定鎖骨，保護下方的神經血管束。
desc_en: Stabilizes the clavicle during intense paddling or when pushing the board for a duck dive, protecting underlying neurovascular bundles.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助呼氣。在衝浪換氣節奏緊湊時（如過浪區），幫助快速排氣。
desc_en: Assists expiration. Helps rapidly expel air when breathing windows are short (e.g., paddling through the impact zone).
